intro: Thottea longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-peduncled thottea, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated petioles. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate inflorescences, which are borne on long, slender peduncles. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
